intro: Synthlipsis greggii, commonly known as the Gregg's ghostflower, is a rare and enigmatic plant native to the Chihuahuan Desert in Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate, pale blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant is known for its low-growing habit and succulent leaves, which help it survive in arid conditions. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun exposure. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
